parse.title: List of places with columnar jointed volcanics

text.*:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (August 2012) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Basalt columns seen on Porto Santo Island.

Columnar jointed volcanic rocks exist in many places on Earth. Perhaps the most famous basalt lava flow in the world is the Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland, in which the vertical joints form polygonal columns and give the impression of having been artificially constructed.

Contents

  • 1 Notable columnar jointed volcanics
    • 1.1 Africa
    • 1.2 South Asia
    • 1.3 West Asia
    • 1.4 Middle East
    • 1.5 East Asia
    • 1.6 Southeast Asia
    • 1.7 Central America
    • 1.8 Europe
    • 1.9 North America
    • 1.10 Oceania
    • 1.11 South America
    • 1.12 Mars
  • 2 Uses
  • 3 Gallery
  • 4 References

Notable columnar jointed volcanics[edit]

Africa[edit]

Curved columns of rhyolitic tuff at the Hong Kong High Island Reservoir
  • Bugarama in Rusizi, Rwanda[citation needed] Columnar jointing in rusizi district, Nzahaha Sector.

This may have formed from contractional cooling of basltic lavas.

  • "Organ Pipes" near Twyfelfontein, Namibia[1]
  • Numan, Nigeria[2]
  • Seliana, Tunisia[citation needed]
  • Rochester Falls, Mauritius

South Asia[edit]

Interlocked basaltic columns at the top of Kavadia mountain at Dewas district, India
India
  • St. Mary's Island, Malpe
  • Gilbert Hill, Andheri, Mumbai
  • forest area of near ( Bagli ) Pipari village of Dewas district (Madhya Pradesh) The rock formation is at Kavadia Pahad (series of seven mountain ranges).

West Asia[edit]

Armenia
  • Garni Gorge, Armenia
  • Near Saint Sarkis Cathedral, Yerevan, Armenia
Turkey
Vertically jointed columnar basalt of Basalt Rocks Natural Monument in Turkey.
  • Basalt Rocks Natural Monument, Boyabat, Sinop Province[3], Turkey

Middle East[edit]

Iran
  • Maku, West Azerbaijan Province, Iran
  • Mount Damavand, Iran
  • Sarbisheh, Iran
Syria
  • Hexagons pool, Golan Heights, Syria
Hexagons pool, Golan Heights, Syria

East Asia[edit]

China
  • Heiyuhe Columnar Joints (黑鱼河柱状节理) [Xianrenqiao (仙人桥)], Longchuan River (龙川江) & Black Fish River, Tengchong
  • Basalt Island area, Hong Kong; including High Island Reservoir area, Hong Kong; although the High Island Reservoir is not basalt but rhyolitic tuff, rich in potash feldspar and quartz phenocrysts.
Japan
  • Tatami-ishi, Kumejima, Okinawa Prefecture
  • Tōjinbō, Mikuni-chō in Sakai, Fukui Prefecture
  • Takachiho-kyo gorge, Takachiho, Miyazaki
  • Genbudō, Toyooka, Hyōgo
  • Keya no Oto, Itoshima, Fukuoka, Fukuoka
Kuril Islands
Columnar basalts at the Cape Stolbchatiy, Kuril islands, Russia
  • Cape Stolbchatiy, Kuril Islands, Russia[4]
Mongolia
  • Kharandaa Khad in Taishir district, on Zavkhan River
Taiwan
  • Tongpan Basalt (桶盤玄武岩石柱), Tongpan Island and Hujing Island (Table island, 虎井嶼), Penghu Islands
  • The Whale Cave, on the seashore, in Penghu County
South Korea
  • Jusangjeolli, Seogwipo, Jeju Island, South Korea

Southeast Asia[edit]

Malaysia
at Kg Balung Cocos,Tawau,Sabah
Basalt Columns exposed along a river in a remote place in Tawau, Malaysia
  • Along a river in Teck Guan Cocoa Village and by the Balung River near Kg Balung Cocos Tawau, Sabah, Malaysia.
Philippines
  • Dunsulan Falls in Mount Samat, Pilar, Bataan[5][6]
  • Bulingan Falls in Lamitan, Basilan[7]
Thailand
  • Mon Hin Kong (Thai: ม่อนหินกอง), in a mountainous area of the Phi Pan Nam Range near Na Phun, Wang Chin District, Phrae Province, Thailand[8]
Vietnam
The Cliff of Stone Plates (Ghềnh Đá Dĩa) near Tuy Hòa city, Phú Yên Province, Vietnam
  • Ganh Da Dia — The Cliff of Stone Plates (Vietnamese: Ghềnh Đá Dĩa), Phú Yên Province, Vietnam[9]

Central America[edit]

El Salvador
  • Cascada Los Tercios, Suchitoto

Europe[edit]

Basalt columns in the Rhön, North Bavaria, Germany
Columnar jointing in the basalt of the Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland
Faroe Islands
  • Froðba, Hov
  • Hvalba and Trongisvágur, Suðuroy
France
  • Thueyts, Jaujac and Fabras, Ardèche
  • Saint-Flour, Cantal
  • Chilhac
  • Saint-Arcons
  • Prades
  • Saint-Clément
  • Moulin-Béraud
  • La Tour-d'Auvergne
  • Bort-les-Orgues
  • Scandola Nature Reserve, Corsica
Germany
  • Linz am Rhein, Mendig, Mayen, Rhineland-Palatinate
  • Hoher Hagen (Dransfeld), Lower Saxony
  • Rhön, North Bavaria
  • Stolpen, Saxony
  • Scharfenstein, Hesse
  • Weiselberg, Saarland
Greenland
  • Qeqertarsuaq, Disko Island
Hungary
  • Badacsony
  • Bér
  • Szanda
  • Szilváskő
  • Somoskő, Hungary-Slovakia border
  • Hegyestű
  • Szent-György-hegy
  • Gulács
  • Haláp
  • Hajagos
  • Uzsa
Iceland
  • Dverghamrar, Kirkjubæjarklaustur
  • Hljóðaklettar, Jökulsárgljúfur
  • Aldeyjarfoss, Þingeyjarsveit
  • Litlanesfoss, Fljótsdalshreppur
  • Kálfshamarsvík, Austur-Húnavatnssýsla
  • Reynisdrangar, Vík í Mýrdal
  • Hellnahraun near Arnarstapi, Snæfellsbær
  • Svartifoss, Skaftafell
  • Gerðuberg
  • Kirkjugólfið
Italy
  • Alcantara River Gorges, Sicily
  • Cyclopean Isles, Sicily
  • Motta Sant'Anastasia neck, Sicily
  • Lake Bolsena, Lazio
  • Guspini, Sardinia
Spain
  • Punta Baja, Cabo de Gata-Níjar Natural Park, Andalusia
  • Castellfollit de la Roca, Girona
  • Fruiz, Biscay[10][11]
  • Pitón volcánico de Cancarix, Albacete[12]
  • Los Órganos, La Gomera, Canary Islands[13]
United Kingdom
  • Giant's Causeway, Northern Ireland
  • The islands of Canna, Eigg, and Muck, Scotland
  • The northern part of the Isle of Skye, Scotland
  • The Isle of Mull and the nearby beach of Morvern, Scotland
  • Samson's ribs, Scotland
  • Fingal's Cave and Staffa, Scotland
  • Ulva, Scotland
Other
  • Rocha dos Bordões cliffs, Flores, Azores
  • Panská Skála, Kamenický Šenov, Czech Republic[14]
  • Zlatý vrch, Česká Kamenice, Czech Republic
  • Sioni, Mtskheta-Mtianeti, Georgia
  • Milos, Greece
Basaltic columns at Milos island.
  • Thunderstruck Rocks (Detunatele), Romania
  • Bazaltove, Ukraine

North America[edit]

Columnar jointing in the basalt of the Pain de sucre (sugar bread) in les Saintes, French West Indies
Columnar basalt at Devil's Postpile in California
Canada
  • North Mountain, Nova Scotia
  • Grand Manan Island (western shorelines), New Brunswick
  • Brandywine Falls Provincial Park, British Columbia
  • Cardiff Mountain, Chilcotin Plateau, British Columbia
  • Keremeos Columns, Keremeos, British Columbia
  • Wells Gray Provincial Park, British Columbia (Moul Falls, Dragon's Tongue, Helmcken Falls)
  • Mount Edziza Volcanic Complex, British Columbia
  • Kelowna, British Columbia (Mount Boucherie, Spion Kopje)
  • Devils Woodpile, British Columbia (Cathedral Provincial Park)
  • Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec
  • Rossport Islands, Rossport, Ontario
Caribbean
  • Pain de sucre (sugar bread) Îles des Saintes
United States
  • Block Mountain, Montana (along the lower Big Hole River)
  • Cascade Range, Oregon, in Eugene and southeast of Molalla
  • Columbia Plateau, Washington
  • Columns of the Giants, Stanislaus National Forest, California
  • Compton Peak in Shenandoah National Park, Virginia[15]
  • Devils Postpile National Monument, California
  • Devils Tower National Monument, Wyoming
  • Elk River Falls, Idaho
  • Hughes Mountain, Missouri
  • Hyalite Falls, Gallatin Mountain Range, Montana
  • Latourell Falls, Oregon
  • Mount Tom (Massachusetts)
  • Palisades Sill, New Jersey and New York, along the Hudson River
  • Paul Bunyan's Woodpile, Juab County, Utah[16]
  • Sheepeater Cliff & multiple other areas in Yellowstone National Park
  • Spokane, Washington (W Airport Dr. onramp)
  • Stanford Rock, Lake Tahoe, California
  • Sweetwater Canyon, Madison County, Montana
  • Turtleback Mountain, Moultonborough, New Hampshire
  • Whatcom County, Washington[17]
Mexico
Basalt columns in the Mascota River, Mexico
Basaltic Prisms of Santa María Regla in Huasca de Ocampo, Hidalgo
  • Basaltic Prisms of Santa María Regla in Huasca de Ocampo, Hidalgo
  • Salto Chico in Cuernavaca, Morelos
  • Flor De La Vida Retreat in Mascota, Jalisco

Oceania[edit]

Australia
  • Bombo Latite, Bombo, New South Wales
  • Narooma Basalt, Narooma, New South Wales
  • Fingal Head, New South Wales
  • Battery Rock Rest Area, Located on the Golden Highway, 15 kilometres southeast of Merriwa and 19 kilometres northwest of Sandy Hollow on the western side of the highway.[18], NSW
  • Sawn Rocks, Mount Kaputar National Park, New South Wales[19]
  • Glass House Mountains, Queensland
  • Burleigh Head National Park, Queensland
  • Mount Scoria Conservation Park, Thangool, Queensland[20]
  • Ben Lomond National Park, Tasmania
  • Cape Raoul, Tasmania
  • Ruined Castle, Falls Creek, Victoria [21]
  • Organ Pipes National Park, Victoria
  • Barfold Gorge, Campaspe River, Victoria
  • Black Point, D'Entrecasteaux National Park, Western Australia
Federated States of Micronesia
  • Pwisehn Malek, Pohnpei, Caroline Islands
New Zealand
  • Blackhead and nearby Second Beach, Dunedin[22]
  • Cape Raoul, Tasmania
    Chatham Islands
  • The Organ Pipes, Mount Cargill, Dunedin[23]
  • Mt Somers[24]
  • Bridal Veil Falls (Waikato), Raglan

South America[edit]

  • Ancud Volcanic Complex, Chile
  • Mocho Volcano, Chile
  • Pino Hachado Caldera, Neuquén Province, Argentina
  • Pedras do Cambira, Apucarana, Brazil
  • Cerro Kóî de Areguá, Paraguay

Mars[edit]

Columnar jointed rocks in unnamed crater wall, Marte Vallis region, Mars. Image courtesy of the High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment, Arizona State University.

Several exposures of columnar jointing have been discovered on the planet Mars by the High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment (HiRISE) camera, which is carried by the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO).

  • Marte Vallis[25]

Uses[edit]

A now-ruined thirteenth-century religious complex called Nan Madol was built using columnar basalt quarried from various locations on the island of Pohnpei.

Gallery[edit]

  • Engraving of a basalt formation. From: Alberto Fortis, Della valle vulcanico-marina di Roncà nel territorio veronese. (1778)

  • Basalt rocks near Detunata Goală east of Bucium, Romania

  • Basalt rocks on the Hirtstein in the Ore Mountains

  • The Bühren Organ Pipes

  • Basalt columns of Porto Santo, Archipelago of Madeira

  • Garni Gorge, Armenia
